intro: Aster oxylepis, commonly known as the woolly aster, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Aster oxylepis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
